docs.lead_paragraph: THE good news is we are living longer than ever before. The bad news is it's going to cost us. As global fertility rates grow more slowly and increasing prosperity enhances life expectancy, a complicated side effect has emerged: big chunks of the world are starting to look like geriatric wards. It is uncertain how the world will pay for them.

headline.main: The World -- Economic Strains; Old, in the Way And Hard at Work

docs.abstract: As global fertility rates grow more slowly and increasing prosperity enhances life expectancy, complicated side effect has emerged; big chunks of world are starting to look like geriatric wards; it is uncertain how world will pay for them; aging will put stress on government finances, drawing money from budgets to pay for pensions and health care; photos; graph (M)
